title: Jorge Cáceres (footballer)
text:
Jorge Ramón Cáceres (born 7 January 1948) is a former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Santiago%20del%20Estero">Santiago del Estero</a>, <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>, Cáceres began his professional football career with <a href="San%20Mart%C3%ADn%20de%20Tucum%C3%A1n">San Martín de Tucumán</a>. In 1973, San Martín sent him on loan to <a href="Am%C3%A9rica%20de%20Cali">América de Cali</a> for one season, but the club soon made the transfer to América permanent. He also played for <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Bucaramanga">Atlético Bucaramanga</a> and <a href="Deportivo%20Pereira">Deportivo Pereira</a> in <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>.
Cáceres was a prolific goal-scorer. He scored in 24 consecutive matches, and led the league with 35 goals while playing for Pereira in 1975. He is one of the all-time leading Colombian league goal-scorers with 182 goals.
In 1976, Cáceres became a naturalized Colombian citizen. He made six appearances for the <a href="Colombia%20national%20football%20team">Colombia national football team</a> in 1977.
